lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Monday appeared reluctant to allow judges to take on a major role in policing the compensation of mutual fund investment advisers. But some justices nonetheless suggested that pay arrangements could be so outsized that the courts may have to step in, The New York Times’s Adam Liptak reported.
